result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany L Scheets

defendant.name: Scheets, Brittany L
defendant.address: N3327 Iris Rd, Lake Geneva, WI 53147

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brittany L Scheets not in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Brittany L Scheets.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendants Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brittany L Scheets in court.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant referred to SPD. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Complaint read by court. Defendant is asking the court to rebook Attorney. Court advises defendant to go to SPD. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.D.H. dob 5-26-1978 or RESIDENCE, OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL FOR EMPLOYMENT PURPOSES. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Brittany L Scheets in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared for defendant. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
